Class ArrayBag

java.lang.Object
  ArrayBag
All Implemented Interfaces:
BagADT<java.lang.Object>
public class ArrayBag
extends java.lang.Object
implements BagADT<java.lang.Object>

This class implements a simple ArrayBag Abstract Data Type (ADT).

Applications using this class can:

  • store string objects
  • retrieve the stored String objects
  • remove the stored objects.

The implementation of this class is the lab 1 assignment for COMP 139 students (Lansdowne campus).

NOTE: the ArrayBag ADT is an unordered collection.

Constructor Detail

ArrayBag

public ArrayBag()
This ArrayBag is initialized to empty. The maximum number of elements is set to DEFAULT_CAPACITY (100).

ArrayBag

public ArrayBag(int initialCapacity)
This ArrayBag is initialized to empty. The maximum number of elements is set to initialCapacity which is provided by the caller.

removeRandom

public java.lang.Object removeRandom()
                              throws EmptyBagException
Removes a random element from this bag. An EmptyBagException is thrown if this ArrayBag is empty.

remove

public java.lang.Object remove(java.lang.Object target)
                        throws EmptyBagException,
                               java.util.NoSuchElementException
Removes an occurance of the specified element from this bag. An EmptyBagException is thrown if this ArrayBag is empty. A NoSuchElemetnException is thrown if the target is not in the bag.
